messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Oz
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Ren!  You made my day.  Someday maybe we could follow the Yellow Brick Road together, all (wait, let me count).... 7 of us.  :-)  And anyone else who d
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Ren! You made my day. Someday maybe we could follow the Yellow
Brick Road together, all (wait, let me count).... 7 of us. :-) And anyone
else who'd like to come. It'd be performance art!

Marji, missing you, Ren, and the young 'uns, and everyone else more than ever!

At 09:52 2/15/03 -0500, Ren wrote:
>You know Marji, I'm really glad I met you. I now have this wonderful visual
>of you and Liam in the woods singing and dancing. It's SO fitting. How
>sweet.....sigh.
>
>Ren
>"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
>growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
>magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
>me....It's in every one of us."
>
> ----Frances Hodgson Burnett




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Oz
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/15/03 3:50:09 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/15/03 3:50:09 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Sometimes when Liam and I are out on a hike, we'll sing those three songs
("If I Only Had a Brain/a Heart/the Noive") followed by "We're Off to See
the Wizard" and we'll do the dance steps (complete with a few steps in the
wrong direction and the pointing thing). What fun! >>

You know Marji, I'm really glad I met you. I now have this wonderful visual
of you and Liam in the woods singing and dancing. It's SO fitting. How
sweet.....sigh.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
